name: AddUserToWorkspace
description:
Add a user to an Asana workspace or organization.

Use this tool to add a user to an Asana workspace. The user can be specified by their unique user ID or email. It returns the complete user record of the invited user.

parameters.name: workspace_global_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. Can be "me", an email, or a user ID (gid).

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable this to receive the response in a readable JSON format with line breaks and indentation. This is useful for debugging but can increase response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description:

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: workspace_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace or organization.

parameters.name: data.user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
